column4: hey guys... i'm trying to write a bash script to rename all "front.jpg" files to "folder.jpg".... these files are in multiple sub-directories.... i've just about given up.. can anybody help me out?
okay this looks awesome... so exec will run the mv command from whatever directory find is currently in... is that right?
find -name OLD -exec mv '{}' NEW \;      should recursively find all files named OLD in the current directory and execute 'mv old new' with appropriate paths.  (untested)
